page.title: 20GENERAL DESCRIPTION - BIRCH
page.content: { Birch}is a small{village}situated on the B1022 leading from Colchester to Tiptree. The community is fairly scattered with both the School and the Church set at the edge of the village residential area. Until recently the majority of people living in Birch worked for the Round Family who are the major landowners in the area. Most of the people living in the village today{work}in Colchester, Tiptree,Chelmsford or London. Inspite of the agricultural bias in land use this is no longer the main employer of local people. The land rises up from the{Roman {River Valley}and although the fields are large and hedges have been removed, many trees have been planted to act as windbreaks. The{soil}is light and sandy and irrigation of crops is often necessary.
